(2)

snow on the last day, & hail on the 28<sup>th</sup>. The
winds were Easterly, & NE, of 2 & 3 degrees
strength, till ye 29<sup>th</sup> & 30<sup>th</sup>, and then SE<sup>3</sup>, S<sup>4</sup>, & SW<sup>3</sup>.

In Dec<sup>r</sup> it was cloudy, w<sup>th</sup> some snow,
till Dec. 8<sup>th</sup> & 9<sup>th</sup>, w<sup>ch</sup> were hail days. Then
cloudy on the 10<sup>th</sup> and 11<sup>th</sup>, & Rain in the Evening.
Afterwards, some cloudy & Moist air; some hail;
till Dec 23, & then Hail, Wind SW<sup>3</sup>. Y<sup>e</sup> next
day snow; && the rest of the Month some
cloudy & Dark, w<sup>th</sup> snow, & some Chair. The
Barom ever since the 18<sup></sup>,

(2)

snow on the last day, & hail on the 28<sup>th</sup>. The
winds were Easterly, & NE, of 2 & 3 degrees
strength, till y<sup>e<sup> 29<sup>th</sup> & 30<sup>th</sup>, and then SE<sup>3</sup>, S<sup>4</sup>, & SW<sup>3</sup>.

In <u>Dec<sup>r</sup><\u> it was Cloudy, w<sup>th</sup> some Snow,
till Dec. 8<sup>th</sup> & 9<sup>th</sup>, w<sup>ch</sup> were Fair days. Then
cloudy on the 10<sup>th</sup> & 11<sup>th</sup>, & Rain in the Evening.
Afterwards, some cloudy & Moist air; some Fair;
till Dec 23, & then Hail, Wind SW<sup>3</sup>: y<sup>e</sup> next
day snow; & the rest of the Month some
cloudy & Dark, w<sup>th</sup> snow, & some Fair. The
Barom<sup>r<\sup> ever since the 18<sup>th</sup>, hath been above 
30 inches, & on Dec<sup>r<\sup> 26<sup>th<\sup> it was 30c84, on Dec<sup>r<\sup> 
30<sup>th<\sup>, 30c96 & 31-00: & lastly on Dec.31, it was 
31c12, w<sup>ch<\sup> is the highest Range of the Quick-
silver in all the Observations, & if I mistake 
not, the highest I ever met w<sup>th<\sup> any where, 
& at any time. 
And now having mentioned the Highest 
Range, I shall take notice of the Lowest: w<sup>ch<\sup> 
was on Jan.21<up>st<\sup>, at 28c36, Wind W<sup>4<\sup>, & Snow. 
In <u>Jan<\sup>.1724/5. the Barom<sup>r<\sup> was above 30 
inches all the beginning of the Month, till
the
